page.title: 08Memories Of A Grandfather.
page.content: A grandfather tells of considerable changes over his lifetime encompassing 50 years.Early memories were of a thriving self-sufficient, rural community.Basic requirements were peat fuelled open fires for all cooking, washing,bathing purposes until Hydro- Electric arrived in the 1960's.Prior to then, Paraffin & later Tilley lamps gave light.Water was carried from nearby streams or wells until the luxury of indoor cold taps in the 1930's.Outside, dry toilets were housed in wooden huts until the 1950's.Bathing was in a zinc bath in front of the fire.Flagstone floors preceded cement downstairs. Chaff(corn husk),feather or horse hair beds preceded mattresses.Wholesome diet from local produce included dairy products,oatmeal,potatoes,vegetables & meat until preserved foods appeared.
